trans-unit.source: Reads a block of bytes from the current stream and writes the data to a buffer.
trans-unit.target: Reads a block of bytes from the current stream and writes the data to a buffer.

trans-unit.source: When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
trans-unit.target: When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

trans-unit.source: The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
trans-unit.target: The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of bytes to be read.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of bytes to be read.

trans-unit.source: The total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: The total number of bytes read into the buffer.

trans-unit.source: This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream has been reached.
trans-unit.target: This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream has been reached.
